headline: Good product based company
pros:
If they offer good salary for you. Just, pick the offer and work for them. You can easily survive for long years.

1. Normal work flow & Less work pressure(Sometimes only)
2. Excellent Job security (I underlined this point again)
3. It is IPO company so, you will get stock bonus/statutory bonus(1500 to 10000)once in a year if your base salary is less than 25000 per month and after 1 year completed.
4. Salary on every last day of the month(No delay)
5. They will give 15K per month for fresher if they hired from college.
6. Free ESI/Medical insurance.
7. Two month Notice period.
cons:
1. Learn new things but not too much(Routine work)
2. Alternative Saturday work
3. Since, most of the managers work long time. You should adjust the politics between teams.
4. No gym, No table tennis
5. Normal hike (Min 4%- Max 13%).
6. Worst HR process for interview. They will bargain your expected CTC as much as low (sometime Current CTC). Don't show your weakness.
7. Grauduaity

headline: Be prepared for the worse, if you decide to join.
pros: It is a very flexible company as you will be able to manage the shift timing and handle your personal life equally. The location is in the heart of the city and it‚Äôs convenient to travel.  The people around are very friendly and the environment is lively. If you are put up in their head office you get to sight the beautiful view of the sea. There is nothing much greater to be told about this office otherwise.
cons:
Firstly, the management is very inefficient. They are money minded, even though you do not belong to a sales team you will be forced to sell their worthless packages. Thereafter, you start lying and loose all the dignity and morality. 
Secondly, when you face an issue and bring the same to the management‚Äôs notice, they do not take an immediate action. Instead, they give you back a peace of mind for complaining the same. 

With these around, you loose your peace of mind, go into depression and spoil your life.

headline: A big NO to this company
pros: The people around you in your office is good but they are manipulated by HR on a regular basis.The HR is king here.
cons: HR don't know how business works but they love to keep control of each businesses.Apart from documentation what skills does HR have.This sector has not much of the option once the company throws you out you struggle to get job in other organisation due to very sector specific work.When you join the company they will ask you to help in building the business & they assure you support.As soon as you start helping them to take the business from 5 lakhs to 15 lakhs they start bothering you.Any moment you can loose your job,even a 4 month old VP in the organisation was asked to leave immediately so they can ask you to leave any moment without any clarity.Your team or teammates says don't work too much & if you disagree they will plan & plot for you.if you don't keep HR happy then you will not last long in this company.The HR will ensure to make your life miserable and always make you small in front of juniors or teammates or your direct reportees.They are the big manipulators in the organisation.Moreover they hire older people & some older people never sink with the idea of today's target.

headline: Technical Consultant
pros: Amazing work life balance. In my 1 year of working at matrimony, there were only a few instances where I had to spend more than 9 hours at the office. Combined with flexi hours, this made my life extremely stress free and enjoyable. The work I was doing was quite enjoyable. Some of the Project Managers and Senior Project Managers are amazing people and colleagues.
cons: There is a constant fear of being fired for no apparent reason. Although I wasn't fired, I have seen plenty of people who got fired without any warning, for no good reason and out of the blue.  In my last month at matrimony, I was suddenly shifted to a different manager. I have nothing nice to say about this manager, and this managerial change actually made me look for other career prospects. I guess I was lucky to have had an amazing manager before him.

headline: I will miss this place.
pros:
1. The ocean view from HQ at Beliciaa Towers. Something I will miss dearly. 
2. Working with the Chief Portal Officer who is one of the most energetic persons you can come across. 
3. There's been a steady and noticeable change in company culture.
4. Good location within the city.
5. Easy to get recognition if you put your head to the task and start contributing. Its real fun to see users appreciating your work (and scary when they criticise), but the impact and learnings are immediately felt. It was a great experience releasing builds on the Playstore and seeing how they impact users. 
6. One of the most well-established service portals to work for. The brand is there to stay.
cons:
1. Salary for some of the lateral hires. New joiners from reputed universities needn't worry about this though. Its really upto the candidate to negotiate during HR rounds. 
2. Slow processes in getting the work done, such as raising tickets with the folks in HQ.
3. Use of the water-fall model and near saturation of most of the money making projects. Opportunities for growth still lie in some of the newer initiatives. 
4. Chaotic server side development because of a very mature and age old tech stack.

headline: Excellent with few clich√©s

headline: Less Salary and Less freedom
pros:
As a fresher i started my career with one of the vertical of Matrimony.com as an Sales Executive (online As Space selling).
Its not a bad place to start your career if you are left with no option
Compared to other company in the segment matrimony has a brand value and greater market share.
cons:
1. Less Salary Structure compared to market.
2. I have seen ppl working even on Sundays continuously for 2-3 months.
3. You to work even to public holidays like 15th Oct or 26th Jan
4. Lot of Politics.
5. Branch Managers enjoys a freedom which he should never have, and HR s are of no use. 
6. Don't know about others but being a top performer a got 10% increment after a year.

headline: Good Company for Beginners.

headline: A great place to work - learn things while you grow!
pros: Friendly and flexible work environment. Excellent strategies have been set and the processes and policies are highly employee friendly. Initiatives are encouraged and a lot of scope is being given to employees to excel in terms of performance. Lot of opportunities are given to grow. The management is open to suggestions and innovation is encouraged to a great extent. A great place to work as it molds and shapes up one's career to the next level.
cons: There is nothing negative in specific.

headline: Poor Management

headline: No growth, Poor team headed by CEO and HRs extreme dissatisfaction among the employees.

cons: No freehand, CEO will decide even the content of the email campaigns, Only thinks about making money in the short run and not the customer friendly approach, Growth will be compromised and you will waste your time working here, No vision for a new recruit, Even the ACs are switched off half of the times. Business Heads can't take the decisions on their own, HR depts clueless about the bonus parts, IPO is a distant dream so don't ever think of getting stock options.

headline: Horrendous - I had hopes to which this comp Shattered!

cons:
Pathetic Pay & No benefits: No Transportation / Car Parking [exclude Sr.Mgmt]
Power cuts (Cost cutting honey coated as "Go-Green Initiative" - Caused freq Headaches
Ergonomics (Furniture) - First Come will get the best chair available
Freedom of thought - Egoist Management - "Yes Sir" Likability!
Sr.Management Heavy Organization - Not Many people to manage : business departments
